image.altText: a search and rescue helicopter

props.synopsis: Emergency crews including South Australian Police, PolAir and the local sea rescue squadron are attending an area close to Granite Island.

title.children: Search and sea rescue underway after teenage boy goes missing off SA's Victor Harbor

image.altText: A child being held by a female doctor

props.synopsis: Despite being just a 90-minute flight from Darwin, nurse Joy Booth says the health service in Timor-Leste is 'light years away from what is provided in Australia'. But that doesn't stop her and other volunteers from providing life-changing surgeries for babies and young children.

title.children: Adelaide nurse shares joys and challenges of operating in Timor-Leste

image.altText: An elderly woman sits on an armchair holding a photograph of her in her younger years smiling next to her husband.

props.synopsis: Ruth Firstbrook visits her husband Roger every morning to fill him in on the latest news. He's a very good listener, and the routine is helping her cope with his death.

title.children: Ruth's daily trips to her husband's grave are helping her make peace with her grief

props.synopsis: As technology continues to evolve, tracking skills are not being called on as often for police investigations. But there are hopes the unique skill can be preserved. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that this story includes the name and images of Indigenous people who have died.

title.children: An abducted girl was found by an acclaimed tracker. There's fears that skill set could be lost

image.altText: A close up of a large patch of purple wildflowers

props.synopsis: Tourists traversing through outback NSW during the winter months have been rewarded with seas of vibrant wildflowers and birdlife after unseasonally early rainfall.

title.children: How a sea of spectacular wildflowers is bringing hope and a blaze of colour to the outback

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt hands over a package to a man in a blue shirt wearing a battered and dirty wide-brimmed hat outside.

props.synopsis: Bruce Ross had moved to the green pastures and rolling hills of South Australia's wine country after running a remote pub on the Oodnadatta Track. But when a rare postie job became available, the open skies and red dirt of the outback called to him once again.

title.children: Publican-turned-postie a lifeline for outback stations and stranded tourists

image.altText: a green MFS truck parks outside the Grote St entrance of the Adelaide Central Markets

props.synopsis: One of the city's most popular attractions, the Adelaide Central Market, closes after a fire broke out in the car park.

title.children: Popular Adelaide Central Markets closes on key trading day after fire breaks out in car park

image.altText: A dark scene with a tower and a shadow

props.synopsis: Almost a million tourists come to Fiji every year. But behind the sun and sand, there's a dark side to the islands, with cartels using Fiji to import drugs into lucrative markets — a drug problem that has now spread into communities.

title.children: Fiji is known for its pristine beaches and friendly people — this is the dark side of the islands

image.altText: Three para swimmers lunge for the wall in a photo finish to a final

props.synopsis: Para swimmers Rowan Crothers and Tom Gallagher have won silver and bronze in a thrilling men's 100m freestyle S10 final. Follow live.

title.children: Crothers and Gallagher win medals in epic final, Aussies claim historic para rowing gold

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Day four: Aussies in action and medal winners
Para athletics: Chad Perris misses out on bronze by 0.005 seconds
Para swimming: Australia win silver and bronze

image.altText: The Repulse Dam near Ouse,  which feeds into the River Derwent

props.synopsis: An evacuate warning has been issued for several communities along the River Derwent, north-west of Hobart, as wild weather continues to batter Tasmania — as it happened.

title.children: Evacuate now warning issued along River Derwent as Tasmanians urged to prepare for floods

image.altText: People swim at a beach next to the buildings of a nuclear plant.

props.synopsis: Canada's biggest province generates 51 per cent of its power from nuclear and while some love it, there are still downstream issues to be solved.

title.children: What can Australia learn from Canada's nuclear experience?

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The shadow assistant minister for home ownership says the Coalition would consider withdrawing GST payments to "hit the states hard where it hurts" and encourage housing supply.

title.children: Coalition would consider docking GST from states that don't build enough new homes

image.altText: Kamala Harris speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Vice-President Kamala Harris said in a statement on X that Donald Trump "disrespected sacred ground all for the sake of a political stunt," when he took photographs at Arlington National Cemetery.

title.children: Harris says Trump's appearance at Arlington National Cemetery 'disrespected sacred ground'

image.altText: Lauren playing hockey dressed in green and yellow

props.synopsis: The head coach of the Australian women's indoor hockey team, Lauren Austin, is facing a number of sexual assault charges, including when her alleged victim was a child.

title.children: Head coach of the Australian women's indoor hockey team charged with sexual assault in Perth

image.altText: The entrance to the Royal Lodge at Windsor Park

props.synopsis: For years, King Charles and Prince Andrew have been at odds over a sweetheart deal cut between Andrew and his late mother to give him lifelong possession of a grand mansion on the grounds of Windsor Castle.

title.children: Charles reportedly wants to force his brother into Harry and Meghan's vacant house. Here's why

image.altText: Waves around a pier

props.synopsis: Damaging wind gusts of up to 100kph are expected to lash Melbourne from 2am on Monday morning.

title.children: Victorians told to brace for destructive winds, 'almost certain' power outages

image.altText: A high shot of Linda Reynolds in a media scrum answering questions outside the WA Supreme Court in Perth.

props.synopsis: It's unusual in Australia for MPs to resort to defamation proceedings, since parliamentary privilege allows them to speak freely in parliament without fear of legal action — but Senator Linda Reynolds felt it was the only way to repair her reputation.

title.children: Why the defamation battle between Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins may have unintended consequences

image.altText: A photo of Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol is surrounded by highlighted print documents

props.synopsis: The new Starbucks boss gets a jet for his commute — but that's just a sweetener.

title.children: It cost Starbucks $100m and a jet-fuelled commute to poach its new CEO

image.altText: A middle-aged woman readies a small dripper of liquid for a small child lying on a bed next to some pink balloons.

props.synopsis: Children began receiving vaccines on Saturday, Gaza's health ministry says, a day before the large-scale rollout and first three-day "humanitarian pause" in fighting agreed to by Israel and the UN's World Health Organization.

title.children: Children in Gaza begin receiving polio vaccine, while hostilities continue to worsen in occupied West Bank

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin sits at a table with paper folders in front of him

props.synopsis: Hawks among Russia's military analysts have urged President Vladimir Putin to lower the threshold for nuclear weapons use in order to "sober up" enemies in the West.

title.children: Russia says it will change nuclear doctrine because of Western role in Ukraine

image.altText: Melissa Wu dives at the Glasgow Commonwealth Games

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud said Victorians will be "embarrassed" as Glasgow underlines its bid for a streamlined 2026 Commonwealth Games, almost exclusively funded by $200 million of state government money.

title.children: Scottish Commonwealth Games bid 'adds to embarrassment' for Victorian government

image.altText: A graphic of a man and an air taxi

props.synopsis: Businessman John Wagner backs the use of flying taxis ahead of the 2032 Olympics but there are still a few hurdles for the technology to overcome.

title.children: Queensland multimillionaire joins 'air taxi' race ahead of 2032 Olympics

image.altText: A scenic view of rocks and mountains with the silhouette of a fighter jet flying low in the bright blue sky.

props.synopsis: Dramatic vision has emerged of an Australian F-35 jet performing risky, low-level tactical manoeuvres above the national park, in an incident believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures.

title.children: Video shows jet performing daring flight manoeuvres, believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures

image.altText: A photo showing a bearded Indigenious man wearing a black hat and looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: Syphilis is continuing to spread through remote Indigenous communities in Central Australia, with shame and stigma keeping many from getting tested.

title.children: Sex can be a taboo topic — but as syphilis spreads, Bradley is having the tough conversations

image.altText: DJ Fatman Scoop smiles for camera

props.synopsis: Fatman Scoop, who topped charts in Europe with Be Faithful two decades ago and later contributed to hits by other artists, died after collapsing on stage at a show Friday in Connecticut, according to officials and his family.

title.children: Rapper Fatman Scoop dies at 53 after collapsing on stage in Connecticut

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day three of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: Jake Gordon slides over to score a try

props.synopsis: The Wallabies have claimed a thrilling, one-point victory over Argentina in appalling conditions in La Plata.

title.children: Wallabies win thriller over Argentina with final kick of the game

image.altText: A young woman wearing glasses and a backpack stands on a university walkway.

props.synopsis: International students and university staff representatives are voicing concern that an international student cap could adversely impact the nation's tertiary institutions.

title.children: 'Sick of being punching bags': Concern that international student cap could spark more university sector job losses

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his government has not changed its policy on questions for the next census, despite being forced to clean up a messy debate over how the nation's LGBTQI+ community will be counted in the next survey.

title.children: Albanese insists Labor has not changed stance on LGBTQI+ questions in census

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair while her nails are filed at a salon in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: If you've been to a nail salon in Australia, chances are it was owned by a Vietnamese Australian. So, where did it all begin?

title.children: How Vietnamese Australians came to dominate the nail salon industry

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Always said you'd smash Hard Quiz? I'll believe it when I see it

image.altText: A man and a woman sit looking in opposite directions appearing troubled.

props.synopsis: You might have got the impression from social media that attachment styles can predict your love life. This take on relationships twists science into "unhelpful nonsense," say psychologists.

title.children: 'Idiocy at its finest': How TikTok gets it wrong about relationship attachment styles

image.altText: Jack Petrou, who has type 2 diabetes, testing his blood glucose levels.

props.synopsis: Politicians regularly trade blows about ambulance ramping, elective surgery waiting lists, and maternity care. But little is being debated about preventative health.

title.children: Dad of three turns to clinic in diabetes 'hotspot' after watching father lose toes to Australia's fastest growing condition

image.altText: a woman putting a voting ballot paper in a box

props.synopsis: Fairfield City Council and Liverpool City Council are the only two Sydney councils using private contractors to facilitate local elections. Private contractors were more widely used in the past, and the pricing regulator claims they're key to keeping election costs competitive.

title.children: Out of 128 local elections taking place in coming weeks, two will be run by private contractors. Here's why

image.altText: Flower beds in full bloom.

props.synopsis: September's arrival signals the beginning of spring in Australia. But not everywhere follows the same system when it comes to changing seasons.

title.children: September 1 marks the beginning of spring in Australia. But how are the seasons measured elsewhere?
